oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Concordia Lutheran Church, 2002 February
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Concordia Lutheran Church located at 3501 Central Avenue in Nashville, Tennessee. The church was built in 1937. The foundation is stone. The exterior walls are brick. The roof is gabled and comprised of asphalt shingles. The windows are colored glass with wooden frames. Some of the windows are arched. Secondary windows are rectangular. The doors are wood with glass windows and metal fixtures. The main doors have an arched entryway. Special features include a bell tower on the addition. The addition has a stone foundation, brick walls, an asphalt shingle roof with gable, and colored glass windows as well. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Concordia Lutheran Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
